action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I'm starting with a common five-letter English word that has a good balance of vowels and consonants, increasing the chances of getting at least one letter correct.
guess: house

attempts = 1
target_word = mania
guess = house
guess_feedback = h<red> o<red> u<red> s<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: h<red> o<red> u<red> s<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since all letters in the previous guess were incorrect, my next guess will be a completely new set of letters, choosing a word that is also very common and has a different combination of vowels and consonants to maximize the chance of hitting at least one correct letter.
guess: bread

attempts = 2
target_word = mania
guess = bread
guess_feedback = b<red> r<red> e<red> a<yellow> d<red>

guess_feedback: b<red> r<red> e<red> a<yellow> d<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: With the letter "a" being marked as yellow, it means "a" is in the word but not in the correct position, so my next guess will include "a" in a different position, and I will introduce new letters that are commonly used in many English words to try and find more correct letters.
guess: stamp

attempts = 3
target_word = mania
guess = stamp
guess_feedback = s<red> t<red> a<yellow> m<yellow> p<red>

guess_feedback: s<red> t<red> a<yellow> m<yellow> p<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Both "a" and "m" are marked as yellow, indicating they are in the word but not in the correct positions, so my next guess will try to utilize these letters in different positions and introduce new letters that are frequently paired with "a" and "m" in English words to increase the chances of finding more correct letters or their correct positions.
guess: amend

attempts = 4
target_word = mania
guess = amend
guess_feedback = a<yellow> m<yellow> e<red> n<yellow> d<red>

guess_feedback: a<yellow> m<yellow> e<red> n<yellow> d<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: With "a", "m", and "n" all marked as yellow, my next guess will attempt to place these letters in their correct positions by trying different combinations, and I will also introduce a new letter that is commonly used in words containing these letters to see if I can find a correct placement or an additional correct letter.
guess: manor

attempts = 5
target_word = mania
guess = manor
guess_feedback = m<green> a<green> n<green> o<red> r<red>

guess_feedback: m<green> a<green> n<green> o<red> r<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since "m", "a", and "n" are all marked as green, indicating they are in the correct positions, my next guess will keep these letters in the same positions and focus on finding the correct letters for the last two positions, trying to complete the word with commonly used letters that fit well with "man".
guess: mango

attempts = 6
target_word = mania
guess = mango
guess_feedback = m<green> a<green> n<green> g<red> o<red>

guess_explanation: I'm starting with a common five-letter English word that has a good balance of vowels and consonants, increasing the chances of getting at least one letter correct.

Since all letters in the previous guess were incorrect, my next guess will be a completely new set of letters, choosing a word that is also very common and has a different combination of vowels and consonants to maximize the chance of hitting at least one correct letter.

With the letter "a" being marked as yellow, it means "a" is in the word but not in the correct position, so my next guess will include "a" in a different position, and I will introduce new letters that are commonly used in many English words to try and find more correct letters.

Both "a" and "m" are marked as yellow, indicating they are in the word but not in the correct positions, so my next guess will try to utilize these letters in different positions and introduce new letters that are frequently paired with "a" and "m" in English words to increase the chances of finding more correct letters or their correct positions.

With "a", "m", and "n" all marked as yellow, my next guess will attempt to place these letters in their correct positions by trying different combinations, and I will also introduce a new letter that is commonly used in words containing these letters to see if I can find a correct placement or an additional correct letter.

Since "m", "a", and "n" are all marked as green, indicating they are in the correct positions, my next guess will keep these letters in the same positions and focus on finding the correct letters for the last two positions, trying to complete the word with commonly used letters that fit well with "man".
